details.description:
Max Van Kleek is a Senior Research Fellow of the Web and Internet Science Group at the University of Southampton. He currently serves as HCI investigative lead for the EPSRC “Theory and Practice of Social Machines” project, researching personal data technologies, including personal data stores and the behavioural interfaces.

Max received his Ph.D. from MIT CSAIL in June 2011 in Artificial Intelligence with Human-Computer Interaction, and a minor in computational cognitive science, and S.B. and M.Eng from MIT in 2001 and 2003, respectively.

Max has served as a chair of the CHI and CSCW academic conferences, and has published in a variety of HCI and AI journals and conferences internationally. Max has previously conducted research at the MIT Media Lab, Nokia Research, IBM Research, Sun Microsystems, and the US Army Corps of Engineers.
